text: Writing is the only profession where no one considers you ridiculous if you earn no money.
author: Jules Renard

text: The focus on my appearance has really surprised me. I've always been a size 14 to 16, I don't care about clothes, I'd rather spend my money on cigarettes and booze.
author: Adele

text: Money is the seed of money, and the first guinea is sometimes more difficult to acquire than the second million.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

text: One argument goes that recessions are good for female artists because when money flies out the window, women are allowed in the house. The other claims that when money ebbs, so do prospects for women.
author: Jerry Saltz

text: He who controls the money supply of a nation controls the nation.
author: James A. Garfield

text: For a successful entrepreneur it can mean extreme wealth. But with extreme wealth comes extreme responsibility. And the responsibility for me is to invest in creating new businesses, create jobs, employ people, and to put money aside to tackle issues where we can make a difference.
author: Richard Branson

text: You can't have bank holding companies acting as hedge funds. You can't have them taking a million-dollar pension plan for Joe Schmo the bus driver and treat it with the same risk appetite that you treat George Soros' pocket money. It's fundamentally ridiculous.
author: Shia LaBeouf

text: There is a basic lesson on financial crises that governments tend to wait too long, underestimate the risks, want to do too little. And it ultimately gets away from them, and they end up spending more money, causing much more damage to the economy.
author: Timothy Geithner

text: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Nobody climbs mountains for scientific reasons. Science is used to raise money for the expeditions, but you really climb for the hell of it.
author: Edmund Hillary

text: But human nature dictates that there will always be cheaters. That's inevitable. Where there's money involved and glory, there are going to be people that cheat, and there will always be ways to cheat.
author: David Millar

text: The less money you owe, the less income you'll need and the less you'll have to save for tomorrow.
author: Suze Orman

text: Selling out is doing something you don't really want to do for money. That's what selling out is.
author: Bono

text: Money will buy a pretty good dog, but it won't buy the wag of his tail.
author: Josh Billings

text: Financially, I've lost money and made money, but I know my way around financially.
author: Jack Nicholson

text: I am a liberated woman. And I do believe if a woman does equal work she should be paid equal money. But personally I am feminine and I do like male authority to lean on.
author: Julie Andrews

text: Goddam money. It always ends up making you blue as hell.
author: J. D. Salinger

text: I find it fascinating that a lot of business books that do well are from people who've never made any money in business.
author: Gary Vaynerchuk

text: I have plenty of money, unlike other Hollywood celebrities or athletes that have not invested well.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

text: I'd have stopped writing years ago if it were for the money.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: It's easier to force feed people than it is to give 'em what they want. It makes more money.
author: Merle Haggard

text: I don't work very much, and I just sit here waiting for a script that I can't refuse - and I'm not talking about money.
author: Michael Caine

text: The more money an American accumulates, the less interesting he becomes.
author: Gore Vidal

text: A rich man told me recently that a liberal is a man who tells other people what to do with their money.
author: Amiri Baraka

text: You loan your friend money. You see them again, they don't say nothin' 'bout the money. 'Hi, how ya doin'? How's ya mama doing?' Man, how's my money doin'?

text: The passion for money is never fickle.
author: Mason Cooley

text: I don't make decisions based on money.
author: David Duchovny

text: I like my money right where I can see it... hanging in my closet.
author: Sarah Jessica Parker

text: Because bankers measure their self-worth in money, and pay themselves a lot of it, they think they're fine fellows and don't need to explain themselves.
author: James Buchan

text: No man but a blockhead ever wrote except for money.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: Money: power at its most liquid.
author: Mason Cooley

text: The want of money is the root of all evil.
author: Samuel Butler

text: There's so little money in my bank account, my scenic checks show a ghetto.
author: Phyllis Diller

text: Our money is bait money, and bait money is not to be used.
author: Mike Tyson

text: I felt that I had worked hard my entire life and deserved to enjoy all the temptations around me. I felt I was entitled, and thanks to money and fame, I didn't have to go far to find them.
author: Tiger Woods

text: Photography is more about money now but then so are most things.
author: David Bailey

text: Things are done according to money these days.
author: Shirley MacLaine

text: Art for art's sake, money for God's sake.
author: Simon Raven

text: It can be liberating to get fired because you realize the world doesn't end. There's other ways to make money, better jobs.
author: Ron Livingston

text: I've never been able to understand why a Republican contributor is a 'fat cat' and a Democratic contributor of the same amount of money is a 'public-spirited philanthropist'.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: But there are too many people that make so much money at the cost of lives of other humans and for no reason but to make the money.
author: Lily Tomlin

text: It is a fact that around the world the elites of every country are making money.
author: Hillary Clinton

text: I definitely spend the most money on shoes, partly because vintage footwear can be a little funky - in a bad way. I like to keep things pretty simple up top and then go weird with the shoes.
author: Chloe Sevigny

text: I don't feel comfortable defending my clothes. But if you've got the money to afford them, then buy something from me. Just don't buy too much.
author: Vivienne Westwood

text: All my life I knew that there was all the money you could want out there. All you have to do is go after it.
author: Curtis Carlson

text: You know, my main reaction to this money thing is that it's humorous, all the attention to it, because it's hardly the most insightful or valuable thing that's happened to me.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Countries have lost their culture because what they wanted was money. Money became the running theme in every country and culture was sacrificed.
author: Yoko Ono

text: My body can't put anyone in jeopardy of not making money anymore - my body is just not on the table that way anymore.
author: Christina Aguilera

text: And I think the more money you put in people's hands, the more they will spend. And if they don't spend it, they invest it. And investing it is another way of creating jobs. It puts money into mutual funds or other kinds of banks that can go out and make loans, and we need to do that.
author: Michael Bloomberg

text: As one digs deeper into the national character of the Americans, one sees that they have sought the value of everything in this world only in the answer to this single question: how much money will it bring in?
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

text: Look, we know we screwed up when we were in the majority. We fell in love with power. We spent way too much money - especially on earmarks. There was too much corruption when we ran this place. We were guilty. And that's why we lost.
author: Eric Cantor

text: I've got all the money I'll ever need, if I die by four o'clock.
author: Henny Youngman

text: In my opinion MS is a lot better at making money than it is at making good operating systems.
author: Linus Torvalds

text: I'm not really interested in making money.
author: Steven Spielberg

text: Big money is ruining the political system.
author: Arlen Specter

text: What we get from this adventure is just sheer joy. And joy is, after all, the end of life. We do not live to eat and make money.
author: George Leigh Mallory

text: Those carrying a credit card balance should scale back to making the minimum payment each month so they have more money to put into savings.
author: Suze Orman

text: The day, water, sun, moon, night - I do not have to purchase these things with money.
author: Plautus

text: If you don't have integrity, you have nothing. You can't buy it. You can have all the money in the world, but if you are not a moral and ethical person, you really have nothing.
author: Henry Kravis

text: The fellow that has no money is poor. The fellow that has nothing but money is poorer still.
author: Billy Sunday

text: I've never preached one sermon on money, on just finances. I want to stay away from it.
author: Joel Osteen

text: Labor was the first price, the original purchase - money that was paid for all things.
author: Adam Smith

text: To have done anything just for money is to have been truly idle.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: A nation that continues year after year to spend more money on military defense than on programs of social uplift is approaching spiritual doom.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: The circulation of confidence is better than the circulation of money.
author: James Madison

text: We shall never get people whose time is money to take much interest in atoms.
author: Samuel Butler

text: The nice thing about the gallery shows is that without having to pay any money you can just go and see it.
author: Yoko Ono

text: The first requisite of a sound monetary system is that it put the least possible power over the quantity or quality of money in the hands of the politicians.
author: Henry Hazlitt

text: Money does not guarantee success.
author: Jose Mourinho

text: Capitalism is using its money we socialists throw it away.
author: Fidel Castro

text: Boxing is the only sport you can get your brain shook, your money took and your name in the undertaker book.
author: Joe Frazier

text: Neither money nor position can atone to me for low birth.
author: Anthony Trollope

text: I remember thinking that I'd way rather give my parents my money, and not have to like have them go to work anymore, you know what I mean. Because I'd way rather spend more time with them.
author: Shaun White

text: Money doesn't make you happy. I now have $50 million but I was just as happy when I had $48 million.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

text: We have a new generation of very rich people who want to do more with their money than buy a lot of expensive toys. They want to live meaningful lives.
author: Peter Singer

text: I can make more generals, but horses cost money.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: There was one thing my daddy wouldn't tolerate in any shape, form or fashion, and that was being unkind or rude to somebody. That was just very important to my folks. And as it turns out, that was a legacy that he left me that money can't buy, is how to be able to treat people.
author: Paula Deen

text: Making a movie requires 20 to 500 people to make and a lot of money and the stakes are a lot higher.
author: Alanis Morissette

text: Money makes your life easier. If you're lucky to have it, you're lucky.
author: Al Pacino

text: So you think that money is the root of all evil. Have you ever asked what is the root of all money?
author: Ayn Rand

text: All money means to me is a pride in accomplishment.
author: Ray Kroc

text: I did my time for the rape. I paid my money to Las Vegas. I paid my dues.
author: Mike Tyson

text: A simple fact that is hard to learn is that the time to save money is when you have some.
author: Joe Moore

text: Any fool can make enough money to survive. It's another thing to keep yourself consistently entertained. It's a lot of work, and a lot of fun, to make a life.
author: Robert Fulghum

text: To understand someone, find out how he spends his money.
author: Mason Cooley

text: Money isn't important, but you have to have enough, so you don't have to think about it. Thinking about money is a drag.
author: Jarvis Cocker

text: Ridiculous yachts and private planes and big limousines won't make people enjoy life more, and it sends out terrible messages to the people who work for them. It would be so much better if that money was spent in Africa - and it's about getting a balance.
author: Richard Branson

text: People may take a job for more money, but they often leave it for more recognition.
author: Bob Nelson

text: Thinking in its lower grades, is comparable to paper money, and in its higher forms it is a kind of poetry.
author: Havelock Ellis

text: You reach a point where you don't work for money.
author: Walt Disney

text: To give real service you must add something which cannot be bought or measured with money, and that is sincerity and integrity.
author: Douglas Adams

text: I saw Deep Purple live once and I paid money for it and I thought, 'Geez, this is ridiculous.' You just see through all that sort of stuff. I never liked those Deep Purples or those sort of things. I always hated it. I always thought it was a poor man's Led Zeppelin.

text: Money and women are the most sought after and the least known about of any two things we have.
author: Will Rogers

text: If one man in the country could take all the money, what was the use of passing any bills about it?
author: Davy Crockett

text: I always say, 'People first, then money, then things.'
author: Suze Orman

text: What counts is what you do with your money, not where it came from.
author: Merton Miller

text: I think when money starts to corrupt journalism, it undermines the journalism, and it undermines the credibility of the product, and you end up not succeeding.
author: Walter Isaacson

text: If you real desire is to be good, there is no need to wait for the money before you do it you can do it now, this very moment, and just where you are.
author: James Allen

text: Never, ever invest money that you will need prior to three to five years - minimum.
author: Suze Orman

text: Often people attempt to live their lives backwards they try to have more things, or more money, in order to do more of what they want, so they will be happier.
author: Margaret Young

text: You can be young without money but you can't be old without it.
author: Tennessee Williams

text: A man with money is no match against a man on a mission.
author: Doyle Brunson

text: Money is the string with which a sardonic destiny directs the motions of its puppets.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

text: An actress is not a machine, but they treat you like a machine. A money machine.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: I can inspire people on how to use money, how to get economically powerful.
author: Mike Tyson

text: I've got my eye on a few things to spend my money on. I've got my own bank card but I am really good with money. I don't spend too much at all.
author: Justin Bieber

text: It's good to have money and the things that money can buy, but it's good, too, to check up once in a while and make sure that you haven't lost the things that money can't buy.
author: George Horace Lorimer

text: I think that lawyers are terrible at admitting that they're wrong. And not just admitting it also realizing it. Most lawyers are very successful, and they think that because they're making money and people think well of them, they must be doing everything right.
author: Alan Dershowitz

text: If money was my only motivation, I would organize myself differently.
author: Placido Domingo

text: I think that money spoils most things, once it becomes the primary motivating force.
author: John Cleese

text: I'm not sure about the selling part, but I've always found that the things I've worn on tour have moved over to what people wear every day. Sometimes the things I wore in the beginning before I had money were things I put together.
author: Steven Tyler

text: A majority, perhaps as many as 75 percent, of abortion clinics are in areas with high minority populations. Abortion apologists will say this is because they want to serve the poor. You don't serve the poor, however, by taking their money to terminate their children.
author: Alveda King

text: I think money is due for some sort of collapse. People are going to realize that money has a half-life, like radioactive elements.
author: Doug Coupland

text: As kids we didn't complain about being poor we talked about how rich we were going to be and made moves to get the lifestyle we aspired to by any means we could. And as soon as we had a little money, we were eager to show it.
author: Jay-Z

text: If saving money is wrong, I don't want to be right!
author: William Shatner

text: When I sent those scripts, that was the lowest point of my life. We'd just had our second son, and when I went to collect them from hospital, I went to the bank to try and get some money to buy some diapers, the screen showed I've got $26 left.

text: I've always said money may buy you a fine dog, but only love can make it wag its tail.
author: Kinky Friedman

text: The inequalities are greater now than in '92. Some states have equalized per-pupil spending but they set the 'equal level' very low, so that wealthy districts simply raise extra money privately.
author: Jonathan Kozol

text: Maturity: Be able to stick with a job until it is finished. Be able to bear an injustice without having to get even. Be able to carry money without spending it. Do your duty without being supervised.
author: Ann Landers

text: I hesitate to deposit money in a bank. I am afraid I shall never dare to take it out again. When you go to confession and entrust your sins to the safe-keeping of the priest, do you ever come back for them?
author: Jean Baudrillard

text: I'm not overly alarmist about it, but I do think there are some worrying signs, like the growing accumulation of wealth by a very small proportion of the population, plus elections in the US are much more dominated by money than anywhere else calling itself a democracy.
author: Peter Singer

text: I can't afford to die I'd lose too much money.
author: George Burns

text: For my scale, how I grew up and live my life, I'm making plenty of money.
author: Louis C. K.

text: False opinions are like false money, struck first of all by guilty men and thereafter circulated by honest people who perpetuate the crime without knowing what they are doing.
author: Joseph de Maistre

text: If we're going to spend a lot of money to deal with the problem of 200 million guns in the country owned by 65 million gun owners, we ought to have a system which will work and catch criminals.
author: John Dingell

text: If borrowing and spending all this money led to more jobs than we would be at full employment already.
author: Paul Ryan

text: I mean, Dodd-Frank is strangling small community banks. It doesn't make any difference what the interest rate is. They're not - they're not going to loan the money because they can't make any money for one thing plus the cost of compliance.
author: Rick Perry

text: That is why the analogy of stealing does not work. With a thief, we want to know how much money he stole, and from whom. With the artist it is not how much he took and from whom, but what he did with it.
author: Lukas Foss

text: Nothing that is God's is obtainable by money.
author: Tertullian

text: If I feel strongly, I say it. I know I can do more good by being vocal than by staying quiet. I'd have a whole lot more money if I lied, but I wouldn't enjoy spending it.
author: Martina Navratilova

text: If you make a living, if you earn your own money, you're free - however free one can be on this planet.
author: Theodore White

text: They got married, they got divorced, and half their money goes out the window.
author: Suze Orman

text: The process by which banks create money is so simple that the mind is repelled.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

text: Money is like an arm or leg - use it or lose it.
author: Henry Ford

text: We've got to put a lot of money into changing behavior.
author: Bill Gates

text: I'm not broke. Like everybody else, I owe money.
author: Marlee Matlin

text: The price we have to pay for money is sometimes liberty.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: I actually think that the economy has got some positives. It's got the market. It's got consumer confidence and it's got banks throwing - I mean central bankers throwing money at it around the world.
author: Jack Welch

text: And of course I didn't make any money from stand up for years, so I had temp jobs. That was the way I made money.
author: Demetri Martin

text: I have no idea how much money I've got.
author: Daniel Radcliffe

text: I never heard of an old man forgetting where he had buried his money! Old people remember what interests them: the dates fixed for their lawsuits, and the names of their debtors and creditors.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: Money is our madness, our vast collective madness.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

text: Money isn't a major motivating force in my life. Nor is my profession. There are other things that I care more about than being an actor.
author: Kevin Costner

text: If you really believe that you're making a difference and that you can leave a legacy of better schools and jobs and safer streets, why would you not spend the money? The objective is to improve the schools, bring down crime, build affordable housing, clean the streets - not to have a fair fight.
author: Michael Bloomberg

text: Labour was the first price, the original purchase - money that was paid for all things. It was not by gold or by silver, but by labour, that all wealth of the world was originally purchased.
author: Adam Smith

text: The civility which money will purchase, is rarely extended to those who have none.
author: Charles Dickens

text: I don't know what to do with it. I'm very fortunate to have it, and it gives you room to maneuver. But the main thing about having money is it means you don't have to worry about it. And that for me is a lovely thing. It's not for fast cars and hookers.
author: Daniel Radcliffe

text: Fame, I have already. Now I need the money.
author: Wilhelm Steinitz

text: The safe way to double your money is to fold it over once and put it in your pocket.
author: Kin Hubbard

text: All I wanted to do was write - at the time, poems, and prose, too. I guess my ambition was simply to make money however I could to keep myself going in some modest way, and I didn't need much, I was unmarried at the time, no children.
author: Paul Auster

text: I made a small fortune. I made a lot of money and I made a lot of other people wealthy.
author: Jim Cramer

text: Brigands demand your money or your life women require both.
author: Samuel Butler

text: Where large sums of money are concerned, it is advisable to trust nobody.
author: Agatha Christie

text: It takes no compromising to give people their rights. It takes no money to respect the individual. It takes no survey to remove repressions.
author: Harvey Milk

text: I don't even know what sound is, much less what it's for. It isn't to make money that's for sure. I've never made any.
author: Don Van Vliet

text: If time is money, it seems moral to save time, above all one's own, and such parsimony is excused by consideration for others. One is straight-forward.
author: Theodor Adorno

text: I went to the bank and proposed that they lend money to the poor people. The bankers almost fell over.
author: Muhammad Yunus

text: Marrying into money was not a good thing for me.
author: Anna Nicole Smith

text: If you would know the value of money, go and try to borrow some.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: I pity the French Cinema because it has no money. I pity the American Cinema because it has no ideas.
author: Jean-Luc Godard

text: Because people have no thoughts to deal in, they deal cards, and try and win one another's money. Idiots!
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: Because I don't take money, I'll go anywhere and do a benefit concert with almost any orchestra.
author: David Ogden Stiers

text: Put not your trust in money, but put your money in trust.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

text: Many folks think they aren't good at earning money, when what they don't know is how to use it.
author: Frank A. Clark

text: If God has allowed me to earn so much money, it is because He knows I give it all away.
author: Edith Piaf

text: The political system is not for the people. The people are secondary to the economy. It's about what generates money, not about what benefits the people.
author: Ziggy Marley

text: Many good qualities are not sufficient to balance a single want - the want of money.
author: Johann Georg Zimmermann

text: It's all about the money.
author: Joseph Jackson

text: Just put down 9/11... I think, on most things I'm liberal, except on defending ourselves and keeping half the money. Those things I'm kind of conservative on.
author: Dennis Miller

text: It is not the employer who pays the wages. Employers only handle the money. It is the customer who pays the wages.
author: Henry Ford

text: The way the bankers have kind of toppled the way money is distributed, and taken most of it into their own hands, is as good as Stalin or Hitler.
author: Mario Batali

text: The thing that fascinates me is that the way I came to film and television is extinct. Then there were gatekeepers, it was prohibitively expensive to make a film, to be a director you had to be an entrepreneur to raise money.
author: Tom Hooper

text: One thing that people keep on saying to me is that the wealth and the fame must have made up for missing out on my childhood. But the idea of money - putting a price on your childhood - is ridiculous. You will never get those years back and you can't put a price on them.
author: Tom Felton

text: Spare no expense to save money on this one.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

text: It isn't enough for you to love money - it's also necessary that money should love you.
author: Kin Hubbard

text: The blues is losing someone you love and not having enough money to immerse yourself in drink.
author: Henry Rollins

text: Unlike my grandfather or my brother, I've actually been able to make some money at a racetrack.
author: John Malkovich

text: Books are the money of Literature, but only the counters of Science.
author: Thomas Huxley

text: Do what you love and the money will follow.
author: Marsha Sinetar

text: I never left France for Hollywood nor stashed my money in Switzerland.
author: Brigitte Bardot

text: Many people take no care of their money till they come nearly to the end of it, and others do just the same with their time.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Money won is twice as sweet as money earned.
author: Paul Newman

text: Money speaks, but it speaks with a male voice.
author: Andrea Dworkin

text: Preoccupation with money is the great test of small natures, but only a small test of great ones.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

text: People don't have time to wait for somebody to paint their portraits anymore. The money is in photography.
author: Robert Mapplethorpe

text: This will never be a civilized country until we spend more money for books than we do for chewing gum.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: You shouldn't have to have money to have a luxury fragrance.
author: Lady Gaga

text: Neither soldiers nor money can defend a king but only friends won by good deeds, merit, and honesty.
author: Sallust

text: Hussein has chosen to spend his money on building weapons of mass destruction and palaces for his cronies.
author: Madeleine Albright

text: I never viewed money as being 'my money' I always saw it as 'the money.' It's a resource. If it pools up around me then it needs to be flushed back out into the system.
author: Louis C. K.

text: Nothing is so strongly fortified that it cannot be taken by money.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: If I can't get the girl, at least give me more money.
author: Alan Alda

text: Most men love money and security more, and creation and construction less, as they get older.
author: John Maynard Keynes

text: Let advertisers spend the same amount of money improving their product that they do on advertising and they wouldn't have to advertise it.
author: Will Rogers

text: If you don't want to work you have to work to earn enough money so that you won't have to work.
author: Ogden Nash

text: For me the greatest source of income is still movies. Nothing - stocks, financial speculation, real estate speculation or businesses - makes more money for me than making movies.
author: Jackie Chan

text: For industry to settle in a country, you first need electricity for electricity, you need some trained workers for trained workers, you need some schools for schools you need some money for money, you need some industry.
author: Evan Davis

text: Money is the last enemy that shall never be subdued. While there is flesh there is money or the want of money, but money is always on the brain so long as there is a brain in reasonable order.
author: Samuel Butler

text: In New York, everyone's desperate for success, desperate for money and desperate to be accepted, but in London they're more laid back about things like that.
author: David Bailey

text: Divorce is one of the most financially traumatic things you can go through. Money spent on getting mad or getting even is money wasted.
author: Richard Wagner

text: Money couldn't buy friends, but you got a better class of enemy.
author: Spike Milligan

text: Our greatest lack is not money for any undertaking, but rather ideas, If the ideas are good, cash will somehow flow to where it is needed.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: Find something in life that you love doing. If you make a lot of money, that's a bonus, and if you don't, you still won't hate going to work.
author: Jeff Foxworthy

text: You know, people make a lot of money talking about me, don't they?
author: Hillary Clinton

text: What white man can say I never stole his land or a penny of his money? Yet they say that I am a thief.
author: Sitting Bull

text: If you work just for money, you'll never make it, but if you love what you're doing and you always put the customer first, success will be yours.
author: Ray Kroc

text: We had access to too much money, too much equipment, and little by little, we went insane.
author: Francis Ford Coppola

text: There are three faithful friends - an old wife, an old dog, and ready money.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: A fool and his money are soon parted.
author: Thomas Tusser

text: I admire directors so much, I find them incredible: they manage such a huge number of people of different characters, think of the money involved.
author: Catherine Deneuve

text: Money is not a motivating factor. Money doesn't thrill me or make me play better because there are benefits to being wealthy. I'm just happy with a ball at my feet. My motivation comes from playing the game I love. If I wasn't paid to be a professional footballer I would willingly play for nothing.
author: Lionel Messi

text: To get rich, you have to be making money while you're asleep.
author: David Bailey

text: A drinker has a hole under his nose that all his money runs into.
author: Thomas Fuller

text: My story is the story of countless millions of children whose families and nations were torn apart for money in the name of Jesus Christ.
author: Sinead O'Connor

text: Remember that credit is money.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: I don't care half so much about making money as I do about making my point, and coming out ahead.
author: Cornelius Vanderbilt

text: If there is no hell, a good many preachers are obtaining money under false pretenses.

text: Nowadays love is a matter of chance, matrimony a matter of money and divorce a matter of course.
author: Helen Rowland

text: This film cost $31 million. With that kind of money I could have invaded some country.
author: Clint Eastwood

text: People have taken time out of their day and spent their money to come sit down at a concert. And it's jazz music-it's not easy for them to get to it. I don't want them ever to feel that I'm taking their presence lightly.

text: In liberal logic, if life is unfair then the answer is to turn more tax money over to politicians, to spend in ways that will increase their chances of getting reelected.
author: Thomas Sowell

text: I'm free of stress and worries now because if I don't like something I'm doing, I just find the fun in it instead of being miserable. Let me have fun with the people I work with, let me have fun making money - when I grew up so poor, ya know?

text: What most people don't seem to realize is that there is just as much money to be made out of the wreckage of a civilization as from the upbuilding of one.
author: Margaret Mitchell

text: Work isn't to make money you work to justify life.
author: Marc Chagall

text: There are few ways in which a man can be more innocently employed than in getting money.

text: Human beings are much bigger than just making money.

text: Who would you want to be giving you advice? Somebody who doesn't have any money?

text: When a fellow says, 'It ain't the money but the principle of the thing,' it's the money.

text: I don't know what your childhood was like, but we didn't have much money. We'd go to a movie on a Saturday night, then on Wednesday night my parents would walk us over to the library. It was such a big deal, to go in and get my own book.

text: People aren't going to throw the kind of money at certain people that they used to.

text: I could easily exist on less money, but I like the way I live now.

text: The people of this country, not special interest big money, should be the source of all political power.

text: It's a kind of spiritual snobbery that makes people think they can be happy without money.

text: I was never sloppy with other people's money. Only my own. Because I figure, well, you can be.

text: Don't make music for some vast, unseen audience or market or ratings share or even for something as tangible as money. Though it's crucial to make a living, that shouldn't be your inspiration. Do it for yourself.

text: I don't make deals for the money. I've got enough, much more than I'll ever need. I do it to do it.

text: As I have traveled throughout my Congressional district, the one thing I heard loud and clear was simply please stop spending money you do not have, rein in spending, live within a budget.

text: After a certain point, money is meaningless. It ceases to be the goal. The game is what counts.

text: I know why most people never get rich. They put the money ahead of the job. If you just think of the job, the money will automatically follow. This never fails.

text: But, having a perfume and license, in general, is a financial necessity. A designer must, to reap back the money spent on prototypes and all that sort of thing.

text: I know a lot of celebrities who are perfectly happy to put their name to something and then leave it at that because the money is good, but I need to have complete control over how something is going to look if my name is going to be attached to it.

text: There is no class so pitiably wretched as that which possesses money and nothing else.
author: Andrew Carnegie

text: Money is like a sixth sense without which you cannot make a complete use of the other five.

text: At this point I have enough money to live 25 lifetimes. You couldn't spend the money I've accrued now.

text: A man is usually more careful of his money than of his principles.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

text: My Vegas act is how I make my money.
author: Rita Rudner

text: That's the trouble with being me. At this point, nobody gives a damn what my problem is. I could literally have a tumor on the side of my head and they'd be like, 'Yeah, big deal. I'd eat a tumor every morning for the kinda money you're pulling down.'

text: To avoid ignorance and bullying, I've had to hide the fact that I'm a troll. You have no idea how much time and money I've spent on electrolysis and hair dye and reconstructive surgery so I can look like this.

text: One thing I have clear is that I don't want to work for money anymore.

text: If money titles meant anything, I'd play more tournaments. The only thing that means a lot to me is winning. If I have more wins than anybody else and win more majors than anybody else in the same year, then it's been a good year.

text: I don't believe we are supposed to go through life defeated and not having enough money to pay our bills or send our kids to college.
author: Joel Osteen

text: Prospering just doesn't have to do with money.
author: Joel Osteen

text: But all the money in the world cannot make you happy either, so there has to be a balance.

text: I have no one to leave the money to. I'm a single man. I like spending my money.

text: Wouldn't it be great if you could only get AIDS by giving money to television preachers?

text: Everybody likes a kidder, but nobody lends him money.

text: I know where I'm putting my money.

text: People really feel that, when they go to the gas pump now, that the oil cartel is holding them by the legs and tipping them upside down and shaking money out of their pockets.

text: Geez, all that money we waste on space exploration just think how many bombs that would buy!

text: People look at me, and they go, 'You're white, you're smart, you must have went to college. You must have grown up with money.'

text: The man who has no money is poor, but one who has nothing but money is poorer. He only is rich who can enjoy without owning he is poor who though he has millions is covetous.

text: They still have some money, and they have needs to supply. They must begin immediately to pool their earnings and organize industries to participate in supplying social and economic demands.

text: If we had 3 million exhibitionists and only one voyeur, nobody could make any money.
author: Albert Brooks

text: Money's a horrid thing to follow, but a charming thing to meet.
author: Henry James

text: We are going as fast as we can as soon as we can. We're in a race against time, until we run out of money.

text: Some people feel that what we're doing makes no sense, that it's just a waste of money. But it's working.

text: He who receives money in trust to administer for the benefit of its owner, and uses it either for his own interest or against the wishes of its rightful owner, is a thief.

text: The only security men can have for their political liberty, consists in keeping their money in their own pockets.

text: Banks have a new image. Now you have 'a friend,' your friendly banker. If the banks are so friendly, how come they chain down the pens?

text: My recollection is - and I'd have to confirm this - but I don't recall paying any money to go to law school.

text: Money and time are the heaviest burdens of life, and... the unhappiest of all mortals are those who have more of either than they know how to use.

text: I know of nothing more despicable and pathetic than a man who devotes all the hours of the waking day to the making of money for money's sake.

text: You never suffer from a money problem, you always suffer from an idea problem.

text: I don't think anybody cares about unwed mothers unless they're black or poor. The question is not morality, the question is money. That's what we're upset about.

text: I haven't got as much money as some folks, but I've got as much impudence as any of them, and that's the next thing to money.

text: And also there wasn't much money in television in those days anyhow.

text: To give money to a woman - and here I must speak as a man - is to deny her special quality, her irreplaceability, and reduce her unique amiability to a commodity. Money takes away her name, while transforming her lover into a nameless customer of a market of appetites.

text: If the money's right, I'll do a film.
author: Oliver Reed

text: I was very fortunate that I saved my money and I still do.
author: Rod Stewart

text: Politics has become so expensive that it takes a lot of money even to be defeated.
author: Will Rogers

text: The darkest hour in any man's life is when he sits down to plan how to get money without earning it.
author: Horace Greeley

text: A woman must have money and a room of her own if she is to write fiction.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: I'm very unstable there's no stability in a musician's life at all. You live on a bus or on the road hand to mouth and you don't know where your money's coming from.

text: I mean, I do think at a certain point you've made enough money.
author: Barack Obama

text: A man is usually more careful of his money than he is of his principles.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: You can get rich making fun of me. I know. I've made lots of money making fun of me.

text: Money and fame made me believe I was entitled. I was wrong and foolish.

text: A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.

text: Money can buy you a fine dog, but only love can make him wag his tail.

text: Even with my divorce and with everything, I don't need money.

text: Time is more value than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.

text: In any investment, you expect to have fun and make money.

text: You need to do the work to bring the money in, but not compromise standards.

text: Money just draws flies.

text: That money talks, I'll not deny, I heard it once: It said, 'Goodbye'.

text: Is it not odd that the only generous person I ever knew, who had money to be generous with, should be a stockbroker.

text: The money I pay for my cultural experiences came willingly from my own pocket - they were not the result of bread being removed from the mouths of the poor so that Miss Thing here could mince off to the circus smelling of roses.

text: You cannot spend money in luxury without doing good to the poor. Nay, you do more good to them by spending it in luxury, than by giving it for by spending it in luxury, you make them exert industry, whereas by giving it, you keep them idle.

text: There are three reasons for becoming a writer: the first is that you need the money the second that you have something to say that you think the world should know the third is that you can't think what to do with the long winter evenings.

text: As they say around the Texas Legislature, if you can't drink their whiskey, screw their women, take their money, and vote against 'em anyway, you don't belong in office.

text: Why are people unemployed? Because there is no work. Why is there no work? Because people are not buying products and services. Why are people not buying products and services? Because they have no money. Why do people have no money? Because they are unemployed.

text: I've always thought anyone can make money. Making a life worth living, that's the real test.

text: I have no money, no resources, no hopes. I am the happiest man alive.

text: If there's something that can be formulated, regulated, give you security, then nobody would lose money. Every movie would be successful. And that's certainly not the case.

text: We need to shift from an economic organizing principle for human civilization, to a humanitarian organizing principle. Making money more important than your own children is a pathological way for an individual to run their affairs, and it's a pathological way for a society to run its affairs.

text: Kids are meant to believe that their stepping stone to massive money is 'The X Factor.'

text: I'd never had money growing up, and it's never been that important to me, except maybe to take our kids on a nice vacation or something like that.

text: All I ask is the chance to prove that money can't make me happy.

text: No woman marries for money they are all clever enough, before marrying a millionaire, to fall in love with him first.

text: He that is of the opinion money will do everything may well be suspected of doing everything for money.

text: When you hire that first person, then you're a boss. You've got performance reviews. You've got complaints about not making enough money. You've got people who are just going to sell your story to the tabloids.

text: Money without brains is always dangerous.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Expensive clothes are a waste of money.
author: Meryl Streep

text: Money and women. They're two of the strongest things in the world. The things you do for a woman you wouldn't do for anything else. Same with money.

text: The lack of money is the root of all evil.
author: Mark Twain

text: If all the rich and all of the church people should send their children to the public schools they would feel bound to concentrate their money on improving these schools until they met the highest ideals.

text: Some artists are working to buy the mansion or whatever the element of fame must bear, but I spend all my money on my show.

text: And we've got to ask ourselves some very serious questions as to whether or not certain religious leaders, in terms of raising money - I hate to bring this up - are pushing hot buttons.

text: Money is just the poor man's credit card.
author: Marshall McLuhan

text: The key to making money is to stay invested.
author: Suze Orman

text: Money is a poor man's credit card.
author: Marshall McLuhan

text: I don't talk about money.
author: Kim Kardashian

text: Too many people spend money they haven't earned to buy things they don't want to impress people they don't like.

text: Hollywood is so fake and people need to realize that people are just people, and you, too, don't need to be born into something or have money or have whatever product someone is hawking on you.

text: You have reached the pinnacle of success as soon as you become uninterested in money, compliments, or publicity.

text: I had no idea that I would ever get involved with something like lending money to poor people, given the circumstances in which I was working in Bangladesh.

text: Capital is money, capital is commodities. By virtue of it being value, it has acquired the occult ability to add value to itself. It brings forth living offspring, or, at the least, lays golden eggs.

text: You know, a lot of people are just interested in, in building a company so they can make money and get out.

text: Sooner or later, we sell out for money.

text: Almost the only persons who may be said to comprehend even approximately the significance, principles, and purposes of Socialism are the chief leaders of the extreme wings of the Socialistic forces, and perhaps a few of the money kings themselves.

text: The GAO just released a report that said 22 percent of federal programs fail to meet their objectives. The truth is we don't know how taxpayer money is spent in Washington, D.C., which is why I think we ought to put every agency budget up on the Internet for everyone to see.

text: That's the real secret to job creation - not borrowing and spending more money in Washington.

text: I'm proud to pay taxes in the United States the only thing is, I could be just as proud for half the money.

text: What we really want to do is what we are really meant to do. When we do what we are meant to do, money comes to us, doors open for us, we feel useful, and the work we do feels like play to us.

text: I have a lot of money.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: If the money we donate helps one child or can ease the pain of one parent, those funds are well spent.

text: I don't spend much money on clothes I never did.
author: Lauren Hutton

text: Money is better than poverty, if only for financial reasons.

text: Criminals are never very amusing. It's because they're failures. Those who make real money aren't counted as criminals. This is a class distinction, not an ethical problem.

text: Nothing except the mint can make money without advertising.
author: Thomas B. Macaulay

text: Banks are an almost irresistible attraction for that element of our society which seeks unearned money.

text: When I graduated from high school, it was during the Depression and we had no money.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: Of course, I do everything for money.
author: Christopher Hitchens

text: I'd like to live as a poor man with lots of money.

text: The truth was you can't continue to spend the kind of money our spending on all these entitlement programs. I think we need more people in public life who are willing to say, no, we can't afford certain things. No, we can't do certain things.

text: Let's be honest, I have enough money to never have to work again.

text: You're right on the money with that. We're all like detectives in life. There's something at the end of the trail that we're all looking for.

text: You may never get to that perfect world that you're waiting for where everything's going to be perfect and you got that much money and your house paid off.

text: I grew up in a really small town with not a lot of money, and I liked singing, but it was just something that was a hobby.

text: Wealth flows from energy and ideas.
author: William Feather

text: Money for me today does not really matter.
author: Jackie Chan

text: Don't cling to fame. You're just borrowing it. It's like money. You're going to die, and somebody else is going to get it.

text: If we think we have ours and don't owe any time or money or effort to help those left behind, then we are a part of the problem rather than the solution to the fraying social fabric that threatens all Americans.

text: I think everything depends on money.
author: Alan Bean

text: No man's credit is as good as his money.
author: John Dewey

text: There are two things people want more than sex and money... recognition and praise.
author: Mary Kay Ash

text: If I have enough money to eat I'm good.
author: Shia LaBeouf

text: Why is there so much month left at the end of the money?
author: John Barrymore

text: One must beware of ministers who can do nothing without money, and those who want to do everything with money.

text: I'm tired of hearing about money, money, money, money, money. I just want to play the game, drink Pepsi, wear Reebok.

text: Money is usually attracted, not pursued.

text: You must spend money to make money.
author: Plautus

text: Admittedly, a homosexual can be conditioned to react sexually to a woman, or to an old boot for that matter. In fact, both homo - and heterosexual experimental subjects have been conditioned to react sexually to an old boot, and you can save a lot of money that way.

text: A billion here, a billion there, and pretty soon you're talking about real money.
author: Everett Dirksen

text: If women didn't exist, all the money in the world would have no meaning.
author: Aristotle Onassis

text: I don't blame the players today for the money. I blame the owners. They started it. They wanna give it to 'em? More power to 'em.

text: In the seventies, a group of American artists seized the means not of production but of reproduction. They tore apart visual culture at a time of no money, no market, and no one paying attention except other artists. Vietnam and Watergate had happened everything in America was being questioned.
author: Jerry Saltz

text: At the end of the day, money is just a proxy for votes. That is what makes politics so vulnerable to social media.
author: Sean Parker

text: Who gets the risks? The risks are given to the consumer, the unsuspecting consumer and the poor work force. And who gets the benefits? The benefits are only for the corporations, for the money makers.
author: Cesar Chavez

text: Now workers should have the right to join unions. But unions should not be forced upon workers. And unions should not have the power to take money our of their members' paychecks to buy the support of politicians that are favored by the union bosses.
author: Mitt Romney

text: I don't want to make money I want to make a difference.
author: Lady Gaga

text: We do not have a money problem in America. We have a values and priorities problem.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

text: I don't believe that I personally have been changed by the money. The bad thing is people assume you've changed because now you have money.

text: It was an honor and privilege to arrive to this country 16 years ago with almost no money in my pocket. A lot has happened since then.

text: When an actor has money he doesn't send letters, he sends telegrams.

text: If anyone tells you it's impossible to be fabulous and smart and make a ton of money using math, well, they can just get in line behind you - and kiss your math.

text: Money is the barometer of a society's virtue.
author: Ayn Rand

text: I don't mind that I'm fat. You still get the same money.
author: Marlon Brando

text: Nobody works as hard for his money as the man who marries it.
author: Kin Hubbard

text: People spend time worrying about things they think they have to have and lose perception of what they do have. You can have all the money and material things you want. If you aren't here to enjoy them, what good do they do?

text: Sincerity: willingness to spend one's own money.
author: Mason Cooley

text: It's lovely to have money to give away - that's the bonus of winning the Nobel.
author: Doris Lessing

text: I don't want to make money, I just want to be wonderful.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: It ain't often that a man's reputation outlasts his money.
author: Josh Billings

text: This is our commitment to users and the people who use our service, is that Facebook's a free service. It's free now. It will always be free. We make money through having advertisements and things like that.
author: Mark Zuckerberg

text: I went to the bank and asked to borrow a cup of money. They said, 'What for?' I said, 'I'm going to buy some sugar.'
author: Steven Wright

text: Music has always been my back door to life. It is important for people to find something that excites them. I like the concept that if you do what excites you, you will be rewarded generously, whatever form reward takes, which is not necessarily money.

text: The man whose only pleasure in life is making money, weighs less on the moral scale than an angleworm.
author: Josh Billings

text: Organized labor, if they're doing a responsible job, is going to organize the pooling of small amounts of money to protect the interests of the people who are not rich.
author: Warren Beatty

text: What's money? A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and goes to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.
author: Bob Dylan

text: There are probably several hundred thousand if we narrow the definition to include only those who in their search for money and power are ruthless and deceitful.
author: Henry A. Wallace

text: The American Republic will endure until the day Congress discovers that it can bribe the public with the public's money.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

text: A development deal is where they're giving you recording time and money to record, but not promising that they'll put an album out.
author: Taylor Swift

text: People who identify themselves as conservatives donate money to charity more often than people who identify themselves as liberals. They donate more money and a higher percentage of their incomes.
author: Thomas Sowell

text: Well, the chairman of Federal Reserve just made his move to rescue Barack Obama. We're gonna have QE3. We're gonna print some more money.
author: Rush Limbaugh

text: My generation will actually be the first generation that is tamer than the one that came before it, and it will probably be poorer less fun and less money.
author: Shia LaBeouf

text: I have ways of making money that you know nothing of.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: Go miser go, for money sell your soul. Trade wares for wares and trudge from pole to pole, So others may say when you are dead and gone. See what a vast estate he left his son.
author: John Dryden

text: Take free money. No matter how in debt you are, if your employer offers a matching contribution on a 401(k) or other retirement vehicle, you must sign up and contribute enough to get the maximum company match each year. Think of it as a bonus.
author: Suze Orman

text: Never work just for money or for power. They won't save your soul or help you sleep at night.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

text: Speculation is only a word covering the making of money out of the manipulation of prices, instead of supplying goods and services.
author: Henry Ford

text: France is the country where the money falls apart and you can't tear the toilet paper.
author: Billy Wilder

text: I don't think business news is just for old white men with money.
author: Neil Cavuto

text: In suggesting gifts: Money is appropriate, and one size fits all.
author: William Randolph Hearst

text: We need your help. I need your help. We need money for research. It may not save my life. It may save my children's life. It may save someone you love. And it's very important.
author: Jim Valvano

text: It's a terribly hard job to spend a billion dollars and get your money's worth.
author: George M. Humphrey

text: Gambling with cards or dice or stocks is all one thing. It's getting money without giving an equivalent for it.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: I sat with him for three hours and we did not exchange a single word. At the end he handed me, as he had done before, an envelope with money in it. It would have been much nicer if he had enclosed a greeting or a loving word. I would have been so pleased if he had.
author: Eva Braun

text: To fulfill a dream, to be allowed to sweat over lonely labor, to be given a chance to create, is the meat and potatoes of life. The money is the gravy.
author: Bette Davis

text: It's morally wrong to allow a sucker to keep his money.
author: W. C. Fields

text: I could be making a lot more money now if I had chosen a different kind of movie, but none of that matters to me... I've done the parts I wanted to do.
author: Jessica Lange

text: Bank failures are caused by depositors who don't deposit enough money to cover losses due to mismanagement.
author: Dan Quayle

text: Money is always on its way somewhere. What you do with it while it is in your keeping and the direction you send it in say much about you. Your treatment of and respect for money, how you make it, and how you spend it, reflect your character.
author: Gary Ryan Blair

text: American men, as a group, seem to be interested in only two things, money and breasts. It seems a very narrow outlook.
author: Hedy Lamarr

text: If Warren Buffett made his money from ordinary income rather than capital gains, his tax rate would be a lot higher than his secretary's. In fact a very small percentage of people in this country pay a big chunk of the taxes.

text: What's my motto when it comes to money? Don't put so much emphasis on it!
author: Janice Dickinson

text: I have a lot of money stashed away, but I do live my life from day to day.
author: Elton John

text: Profit is sweet, even if it comes from deception.
author: Sophocles

text: Drug prohibition has caused gang warfare and other violent crimes by raising the prices of drugs so much that vicious criminals enter the market to make astronomical profits, and addicts rob and steal to get money to pay the inflated prices for their drugs.
author: Michael Badnarik

text: Architect. One who drafts a plan of your house, and plans a draft of your money.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: Those whose life is long still strive for gain, and for all mortals all things take second place to money.
author: Sophocles

text: If we define an American fascist as one who in case of conflict puts money and power ahead of human beings, then there are undoubtedly several million fascists in the United States.
author: Henry A. Wallace

text: Research is four things: brains with which to think, eyes with which to see, machines with which to measure and, fourth, money.
author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi

text: I've been very well remunerated for my talents over the years so I really don't need the public's money.
author: George Michael

text: Don't matter how much money you got, there's only two kinds of people: there's saved people and there's lost people.
author: Bob Dylan

text: Money is in some respects life's fire: it is a very excellent servant, but a terrible master.
author: P. T. Barnum

text: Nothing induces me to read a novel except when I have to make money by writing about it. I detest them.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Opposites may attract, but I wouldn't put my money on a relationship of financial opposites.
author: Suze Orman

text: There is nothing so habit-forming as money.
author: Don Marquis

text: If we pollute the air, water and soil that keep us alive and well, and destroy the biodiversity that allows natural systems to function, no amount of money will save us.
author: David Suzuki

text: If you're not staying on top of your money, you are putting your financial well-being at risk.
author: Suze Orman

text: It is money, money, money! Not ideas, not principles, but money that reigns supreme in American politics.
author: Robert Byrd

text: Arab leaders worry more about making money from the profits they get from oil and gas that they turn the other way when Lebanon is being destroyed right next to them. Their neighbours are being murdered, but they only make calculations for their own benefit.
author: Abu Bakar Bashir

text: I decided to pursue music, so I dropped out of school and I told my parents I didn't want any money from them. I got three jobs and I just hit the ground running.
author: Lady Gaga

text: Money is like hormones. It's just how you feel on any given day.
author: Janice Dickinson

text: Hip-hop don't have no fresh energy, none at all. It's money driven, everybody tryin' to make that cheque, nobody putting art in their albums any more.
author: Andre Benjamin

text: Money cannot buy peace of mind. It cannot heal ruptured relationships, or build meaning into a life that has none.
author: Richard M. DeVos

text: Pretty much, Apple and Dell are the only ones in this industry making money. They make it by being Wal-Mart. We make it by innovation.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Congress, the press, and the bureaucracy too often focus on how much money or effort is spent, rather than whether the money or effort actually achieves the announced goal.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

text: I have a problem with too much money. I can't reinvest it fast enough, and because I reinvest it, more money comes in. Yes, the rich do get richer.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

text: We pay for the mistakes of our ancestors, and it seems only fair that they should leave us the money to pay with.
author: Don Marquis

text: If you can actually count your money, then you're not a rich man.
author: J. Paul Getty

text: The chief value of money lies in the fact that one lives in a world in which it is overestimated.
author: H. L. Mencken

text: Life is a game. Money is how we keep score.
author: Ted Turner

text: Innovation has nothing to do with how many R amp& D dollars you have. When Apple came up with the Mac, IBM was spending at least 100 times more on R &amp D. It's not about money. It's about the people you have, how you're led, and how much you get it.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Business is other people's money.
author: Delphine de Girardin

text: If you make money your god, it will plague you like the devil.
author: Henry Fielding

text: It's our money, and we're free to spend it any way we please.
author: Rose Kennedy

text: Nowadays nothing but money counts: a fortune brings honors, friendships the poor man everywhere lies low.
author: Ovid

text: If you are worried about job security and do not have an adequate emergency fund (ideally eight months' worth of living expenses stashed away in a federally insured bank or credit union), you need to focus more on saving money than paying down the balance on your credit cards.
author: Suze Orman

text: From paying off friends' tax bills to rescuing stray dogs and stuffing &pound20 notes into the hands of homeless people, I can't get rid of my money fast enough.
author: Julie Burchill

text: Money is a good thing and it's obviously useful, but to work only for money or fame would never interest me.
author: Annie Lennox

text: Money is like manure, of very little use except it be spread.
author: Francis Bacon

text: I've had people ask me in interviews what it's like to have money, but that's not how it is. I have a middle-class life. I have a room in London but not a house, nor a BMW.
author: Beth Ditto

text: A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.
author: Bob Hope

text: While money doesn't buy love, it puts you in a great bargaining position.
author: Christopher Marlowe

text: Three groups spend other people's money: children, thieves, politicians. All three need supervision.
author: Dick Armey

text: We are used to female writers who use their private lives as unmitigated material being somewhat hormonal this somehow 'excuses' what might be seen as a highly unfeminine ability to turn their personal upsets into money.
author: Julie Burchill

text: I think there's only one or two films where I've had all the financial support I needed. All the rest, I wish I'd had the money to shoot another ten days.
author: Martin Scorsese

text: I'm so touched that complete strangers will send me a script asking me to be in their film. That still amazes me - and sometimes for a lot of money too.
author: Liam Neeson

text: A wise man should have money in his head, but not in his heart.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: Most people work just hard enough not to get fired and get paid just enough money not to quit.
author: George Carlin

text: Want of money and the distress of a thief can never be alleged as the cause of his thieving, for many honest people endure greater hardships with fortitude. We must therefore seek the cause elsewhere than in want of money, for that is the miser's passion, not the thief s.
author: William Blake

text: One of the evils of money is that it tempts us to look at it rather than at the things that it buys.
author: E. M. Forster

text: It would be nice if the poor were to get even half of the money that is spent in studying them.
author: Bill Vaughan

text: Money, not morality, is the principle commerce of civilized nations.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: People don't have fortunes left them in that style nowadays men have to work and women to marry for money. It's a dreadfully unjust world.
author: Louisa May Alcott
